person_analysis.overview: James Han is a University of Toronto Computer Science student with a track record of building real-time, ML-driven interactive systems. He is a Software Engineering Co-op at Canada Life, a Builder Ambassador at Anthropic, and holds leadership roles at UofT Blueprint and UofT AI. His projects, including Persona and Polaris, demonstrate strong end-to-end engineering across CV, speech, and 3D animation.
person_analysis.executive_summary: Combining applied ML, performant web graphics, and community leadership, James ships polished, demo-ready products. With wins at major hackathons, hands-on experience in education tooling (PythonTA, Markus), and current roles at Canada Life and Anthropic, he brings both technical depth and high-energy execution.
key_insights: Proven ability to orchestrate multi-model real-time ML systems with low-latency UX.
Bridges academic platforms (PythonTA, Markus) with industry co-op work and community leadership.
Consistent top performance at hackathons, translating into compelling product demos.
